Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]

Entry.JapaneseText: おじいさん
Entry.EnglishText: Old Man

Entry.JapaneseText: notice
Entry.EnglishText: Notice

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Mao>
Entry.EnglishText: <Mao>

Entry.JapaneseText: select
Entry.EnglishText: Select

Entry.JapaneseText: <Eugene>
Entry.EnglishText: <Eugene>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Annie>
Entry.EnglishText: <Annie>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Tytree>
Entry.EnglishText: <Tytree>

Entry.JapaneseText: <Hilda>
Entry.EnglishText: <Hilda>

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエン
Entry.EnglishText: Kyogen

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエン
Entry.EnglishText: Kyogen

Entry.JapaneseText: 民家
Entry.EnglishText: Residence

Entry.JapaneseText: 歴史書……はて、 借りていたかのぉ？
Entry.EnglishText: You're asking if I've borrowed a History Book?

Entry.JapaneseText: そう言われてみれば…… ちょっと待っておくれ。
Entry.EnglishText: Come to think of it... Give me a moment.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『歴史書』を回収しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You got back the History Book.
Entry.Notes: 歴史書 Refers to a Menu I think

Entry.JapaneseText: 借りていたことを すっかり忘れとったよ。 すまなかったね。
Entry.EnglishText: I had completely forgotten that I had borrowed it. My apologies.

Entry.JapaneseText: ふむふむふむ。 <Cyan>雲海にそびえし古の塔<White>を 探しておるとな？
Entry.EnglishText: Hm hm hm. So you kids are looking for a <Cyan>tower that soars above a sea of clouds<White>, eh?

Entry.JapaneseText: キョグエンやノルゼン辺りに 「山のはるか上に<Yellow>ヒト<White>が住んでいた」 という言い伝えがあると聞いてきたんだ。
Entry.EnglishText: We've heard that there's a legend of <Yellow>Human<White> settlements located high in the mountains between Kyogen and Nolzen.

Entry.JapaneseText: ほうほうほう。 それとよく似た言い伝えなら 聞いた事がある。
Entry.EnglishText: Ohoho... Well, I have heard of a similar legend.

Entry.JapaneseText: ホント？
Entry.EnglishText: Really?

Entry.JapaneseText: 「天高く雲を見おろす幻の庭に、 大いなる宝は眠る」……
Entry.EnglishText: "High above the heavens, a great treasure lies buried in the Garden of Illusions."

Entry.JapaneseText: どうだ、似ておろう？
Entry.EnglishText: Sounds similar, does it not?

Entry.JapaneseText: それはどこにある？
Entry.EnglishText: Do you know where this garden is?

Entry.JapaneseText: 若い頃、ワシはその宝を求めて旅に出た。 山という山を歩き、道なき道を突き進んだ。 そして……ついに宝を見つけた。
Entry.EnglishText: In my youth, I set off on a journey to obtain that treasure. I climbed many mountains and hills, forging my own paths where there were none, and finally... I found it.

Entry.JapaneseText: ホント!?
Entry.EnglishText: Really?!

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシは手に入れる事ができたのだ。 老いさらばえてなお健康で丈夫な身体。 そして、かけがえのない妻と家族を。 それこそが<Yellow>大いなる宝<White>だったのだ。
Entry.EnglishText: Indeed, I obtained a great dealー a healthy body that stands strong even in my old age, and my irreplaceable wife and children. Those are the <Yellow>greatest treasures<White> of all.

Entry.JapaneseText: ワシを笑う者もおる。だがね、 真の宝というものは金では買えん…… 金には代えられんものなのだよ。
Entry.EnglishText: Sure, people laughed at me. But you know what? Real treasures cannot be bought... They are things beyond gold.

Entry.JapaneseText: それで、 その<Cyan>幻の庭<White>はどこに？
Entry.EnglishText: Anyway, do you know where the <Cyan>Garden of Illusions<White> is?

Entry.JapaneseText: さて、どこなのかのう…… ほっほっほっほっ……
Entry.EnglishText: I sometimes still wonder that myself! Ohohoho...

Entry.JapaneseText: そんなに肩を落としなさんな。 そういえばさっき、<Cyan>幻の庭<White>の話を 聞きに来た男がおったのう……
Entry.EnglishText: Oh, don't look so down. Come to think of it, there was another fellow who came by the other day asking me about it as well.

Entry.JapaneseText: オレたち以外に、同じ事を 調べている人がいるのか？
Entry.EnglishText: You mean that we're not the only ones searching for it?

Entry.JapaneseText: 探せばまだその辺に いるのではないかな？
Entry.EnglishText: He's probably still around, if you want to go looking for him.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Veigue>、その人を探そうよ。
Entry.EnglishText: <Veigue>, let's go find him.

Entry.JapaneseText: あの男…… なんと言ったかのお……
Entry.EnglishText: That man... I think I remember what his name was...

Entry.JapaneseText: フ、フ、フ…… フラダンス……？
Entry.EnglishText: Hu... Hu... Hula dance?

Entry.JapaneseText: ワン・ギンに会うとな!? 悪い事は言わん、やめときなされ。
Entry.EnglishText: You're going to meet Wang Gin!? Apologies, but please leave me be lest I say something harmful.

Entry.JapaneseText: 金欲にまみれた、 ろくでもないヤツじゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: He is naught but a no-gooder who is greedy for money.

Entry.JapaneseText: 会えば、不快な気分に させられるに決まっておる。
Entry.EnglishText: Were you to meet him, you'll surely feel uncomfortable.

Entry.JapaneseText: ワン・ギンに 会いなされたのか……
Entry.EnglishText: Have you met... Wang Gin...?

Entry.JapaneseText: ワン・ギンのところで 何をするのか知らんが、 ほどほどで手を引いた方が身のためじゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: I have no knowledge of what you intend to do with him, but I recommend you stay away from him.

Entry.JapaneseText: 街の者はすっかり 軍に頼りきって ふ抜けておる。
Entry.EnglishText: The people of this town had grown completely dependent of the military.

Entry.JapaneseText: あと三十若ければ ワシの腕で盗賊どもを ギッタギタにしてくれようものを……
Entry.EnglishText: If I were only 30 years younger, I would've beaten those no-good bandits out of this town...

Entry.JapaneseText: 自分たちの手で 警備するくらいの気概がないから、 盗賊どもにつけ入れられるのじゃ！
Entry.EnglishText: Heed my words, if you are too weak to defend yourselves from them, those thieves show you no mercy!

Entry.JapaneseText: まったく、どうにか ならんもんかのお……
Entry.EnglishText: Goodness, someone please do something...

Entry.JapaneseText: ベルサスで女王陛下が 素晴らしい演説を 聞かせてくれたそうじゃな。
Entry.EnglishText: I heard that the Queen gave a splendid speech in Belsas.

Entry.JapaneseText: その素晴らしいお話…… ワシもうかがいたかった……
Entry.EnglishText: I would have loved to have heard it...

Entry.JapaneseText: ガジュマか…… あんたも……ジルバ様とか 他のガジュマたちと同じかの？
Entry.EnglishText: You're a Gajuma... So are you like Lady Zilva and the others?

Entry.JapaneseText: 前はヒューマとかガジュマ、 あまり関係ないと思って おったが……
Entry.EnglishText: It used to not matter if one was Huma or Gajuma, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: ジルバ様がガジュマを 擁護するような事を おっしゃったようじゃないか。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems that Lady Zilva has said something in support of Gajuma.

Entry.JapaneseText: それがなんだか 腹立たしい気がしてな……
Entry.EnglishText: That makes me angry...

Entry.JapaneseText: 揺れとる…… こりゃ、近いの……
Entry.EnglishText: The ground is shaking... It must be close...

Entry.JapaneseText: とてもおいしいものを 発明したんじゃ。
Entry.EnglishText: I have invented quite the tasty meal.

Entry.JapaneseText: 食ってみたいかの？
Entry.EnglishText: Would you like to have a taste?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>食べますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Take a bite? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: では５００００ガルドで どうじゃ？
Entry.EnglishText: How does spending 50,000 Gald for it sound?

Entry.JapaneseText: ちと高いが、色々と手間が かかっておるんじゃ。 どうかの？
Entry.EnglishText: I understand it's expensive, but it took me great pains to prepare this. What say you?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>払いますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Will you pay the old man? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: では……
Entry.EnglishText: Here you go...

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『<item:20000015>』を食べました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>Ate "<item:20000015>."

Entry.JapaneseText: みそおでん……これが……
Entry.EnglishText: So this is... Miso Oden...

Entry.JapaneseText: みそおでん、サイコー！ ドウマイじゃん！
Entry.EnglishText: Miso Oden's the best! It's sooo tasty~!

Entry.JapaneseText: みそおでん…… うむ……これだな。
Entry.EnglishText: Miso Oden... This is the stuff...

Entry.JapaneseText: おいしい…… お父さんに食べさせて あげたかったな……
Entry.EnglishText: It's so delicious... I wish my father could have had some...

Entry.JapaneseText: くぅぅ、うめえぜ！ こいつぁ五つ星を越えて、 末広がりの八つ星だぜ！
Entry.EnglishText: Ooooh, dang that's tasty! This is worth more than five stars! Why, I'll give it eight!

Entry.JapaneseText: いけるわね…… 「星の乾杯」に合いそうだわ。
Entry.EnglishText: How splendid... This would pair well with a 'toast to the stars'.
Hm...

Entry.JapaneseText: うまいじゃろ？ ５００００ガルド払って 損はなかろう？
Entry.EnglishText: Was it not tasty? It was worth that 50,000 Gald, wasn't it?

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『<item:20000015>』のレシピを入手しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>Obtained recipe for "<item:20000015>"!

Entry.JapaneseText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.EnglishText: [VARIABLE]
Entry.Notes: DON'T EDIT THIS, IT'S A DUMMY ENTRY

Entry.JapaneseText: お金が足りないようじゃな。 お金ができたら、 いつでも分けてやるぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems like you don't have enough money. Save up a bit more and return when you have enough.

Entry.JapaneseText: そうかい？ 食べたくなったら、 いつでも来るんじゃぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Is that so? Feel free to stop by if you'd ever like to try it.

Entry.JapaneseText: そうかい？ 食べたくなったら、 いつでも来るんじゃぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Is that so? Feel free to stop by if you'd ever like to try it.

Entry.JapaneseText: カレギア中で軍が せわしなく動いとるそうじゃの。
Entry.EnglishText: It seems that the Callegean Army is starting to hurry their maneuvers.

Entry.JapaneseText: しばらく おとなしくしておるのが 吉かもしれんの……
Entry.EnglishText: It might be good to lay low for the time being...

Entry.JapaneseText: カレギア中で、 ガジュマとヒューマが 争っとるという話じゃが……
Entry.EnglishText: I heard that Huma and Gajuma have been fighting throughout Callegea, but...

Entry.JapaneseText: ここキョグエンでは、 そんな話はまったくないな。
Entry.EnglishText: ...such conflict does not exist here in Kyogen.

Entry.JapaneseText: 最近いろいろと考えさせられてな。 哲学書に目を通して思索の幅を 広げたいと思っておるのじゃよ。
Entry.EnglishText: I've been doing a lot of thinking as of late. I would like to expand my horizons by reading up on philosophy.

Entry.JapaneseText: うん？ 哲学書を貸してくれると いうのかね？
Entry.EnglishText: Hm? You mean to say that you would be able to lend me a Philosophy book?

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140> はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『哲学書』を貸し出しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You lent the Philosophy Book.

Entry.JapaneseText: おおっ！ 貸してくれるのか。 それはありがたいのう。 さっそく目を通させてもらうぞ。
Entry.EnglishText: Oh! Thank you for lending it to me. I'll read it right away.

Entry.JapaneseText: なんじゃ、違うのか……
Entry.EnglishText: No, that's not the book I want...

Entry.JapaneseText: この本のおかげで思索の幅を 広げることができたぞい。 ありがとう。
Entry.EnglishText: Thanks to this book, I was able to expand my horizons.

Entry.JapaneseText: <Green>『哲学書』を回収しました。
Entry.EnglishText: <Green>You got back the Philosophy Book.

Entry.JapaneseText: 日々これ勉強なり、じゃな。
Entry.EnglishText: I'm learning something new every day.

Entry.JapaneseText: ……すまぬが、もう少しだけ 待っていてくれるかのう。
Entry.EnglishText: ...My apologies, but I'd like to hold onto the book for a little while longer.

Entry.JapaneseText: 哲学なんぞ役に立たんと ほざくやからがいるが、 ありゃ間違いだ。
Entry.EnglishText: There are those who think philosophy is of no use, but they are mistaken.

Entry.JapaneseText: 哲学には人が生きるための ヒントがちりばめられとる。
Entry.EnglishText: Philosophy is strewn with hints on how we can best live our lives.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0><scale:140>休憩しますか？ はい いいえ
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0><scale:140>Would you like to rest? Yes No

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『ご先祖様の肖像画』 ものしりじいさんの ご先祖様の肖像画。 右から曾祖父母と曾々祖父、 曾々祖母。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Portrait of an Ancestor - A portrait of the wise old man's ancestor. Right to left: Great-grandparents, great-great-grandparents, and great-great-grandmother.

Entry.JapaneseText: <speed:0>『書画』 二百年前の書道家、ネイ・サンが 書いたとされる伝説の逸品。 「愛は永遠」という意味らしいが、 ネイ・サンが独自に開発した文字ゆえ、 正確な意味を知る者はいない。
Entry.EnglishText: <speed:0>- Calligraphic Work - A masterpiece created by a legendary calligrapher named Nei San two centuries ago. It is said to mean "Love is eternal" however, due to Nei San's unique style and its age, no one can confirm if its true meaning.
